title: How to Make Warm Muesli

steps.headline: Pour the apple juice and water into a heavy-based saucepan.
Bring the liquid and fruit to the boil.
Reduce the heat to a simmer.
steps.description: Stir in the grain. Simmer until soft (do not cover).

steps.headline: Remove the softened grain from the heat.
steps.description: Cover the saucepan and leave to stand for 15 minutes. The grain will continue to swell.

steps.headline: Sweeten with the sweetener of choice.
steps.description: Top with the remaining fresh fruit. Add a dollop of yoghurt if desired.

steps.headline: Pour the liquid of your choice into a saucepan.
steps.description: Add an additional 1 1/2 cups water to assist cooking.

steps.headline: Reduce the heat to low.
steps.description: Simmer the cooking oats for 5 to 7 minutes. Stir now and then.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Add the apples and nuts and stir through. Drizzle over with honey or maple syrup.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Add a dollop of cream or yogurt if wished.

text: Warm muesli #1 Pour the apple juice and water into a heavy-based saucepan. Add half of the fruit. Bring the liquid and fruit to the boil.  Reduce the heat to a simmer. Stir in the grain. Simmer until soft (do not cover). Remove the softened grain from the heat. Cover the saucepan and leave to stand for 15 minutes. The grain will continue to swell. Sweeten with the sweetener of choice. Top with the remaining fresh fruit. Add a dollop of yoghurt if desired. Warm muesli #2 Pour the liquid of your choice into a saucepan. Add an additional 1 1/2 cups water to assist cooking. Bring to the boil. Add the oats. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer the cooking oats for 5 to 7 minutes. Stir now and then. Remove from the heat. Add the apples and nuts and stir through. Drizzle over with honey or maple syrup. Serve. Add a dollop of cream or yogurt if wished. Finished.
